intro: Minuartia sublineata, commonly known as the pale sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairless stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Minuartia sublineata is often found in tundra and mountainous areas across the northern hemisphere.
